titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Ann Weisgarber Accessions
titlestmt.author: Tabitha Henderson

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-23 13:28:03 -0500.

change.item: Revised for ArchivesSpace by Katie Salzmann

did.head: Collection Summary
did.unittitle: Ann Weisgarber Accessions
did.abstract: Multiple accessions documenting the writing career of Ann Weisgarber, author of The Personal History of Rachel Dupree (2010), The Promise (2013), and The Glovemaker (2019).
did.physloc: Materials may be stored off-site. Advance notice is required for use: https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/makearesearchappointment.html.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Ann Weisgarber Accessions, The Wittliff Collections, Texas State University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Multiple accessions documenting the writing career of Ann Weisgarber, author of The Personal History of Rachel Dupree (2010), The Promise (2013), and The Glovemaker (2019).

bioghist.head: Biographical Notes
bioghist.p: Ann Weisgarber lives in Galveston, Texas and is the author of several novels. Her first, The Personal History of Rachel DuPree, is set in the South Dakota Badlands in 1917. It was nominated for England's 2009 Orange Prize and for the 2009 Orange Award for New Writers. In the United States, The Personal History of Rachel DuPree won the Stephen Turner Award for New Fiction and the Langum Prize for American Historical Fiction. JuVee Productions has optioned the film rights and Viola Davis will play Rachel DuPree. Filming is scheduled for 2018.

Weisgarber's second novel, The Promise, takes place in 1900 on Galveston Island at the time of America's deadliest natural disaster. It was shortlisted for the United Kingdom's Walter Scott Prize for Historical Fiction, was the finalist for the Spur Award for Best Western Historical Fiction, and was a finalist for the Ohioana Book Award for Fiction. Her third book to date, The Glovemaker, was published in 2018 and is set in Utah's deep canyon country during the winter of 1888.

Weisgarber's archive preserves many aspects of her writing career: her early works including poetry and short stories, interviews, manuscript drafts, research materials, correspondence with editors, agents, and readers, reviews and publicity material, foreign editions and artifacts. Also present are materials from her tenure as the artist-in-residence at Badlands National Park while she was working on The Personal History of Rachel Dupree.

Weisgarber was born and raised in Ohio and graduated from Wright State University in Dayton with a Bachelor of Arts in Social Work. She earned a Master of Arts in Sociology from the University of Houston and became a social worker in psychiatric and nursing home facilities and also taught sociology at Wharton County Junior College in Texas.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Materials from the Wittliff Collections are made available for use in research, teaching, and private study. The user assumes responsibility for determining copyright status, obtaining permission to publish, and abiding by U.S. copyright laws. https://www.thewittliffcollections.txstate.edu/research/visit/policies/publication.html

did.unittitle: Accession 2017-096
did.abstract: This accession consists of archival materials relating to the writing career of author, Ann Weisgarber from 1989-2017. Majority of the materials in the collection are research and drafts for Weisgarber's various works such as The Personal History of Rachel DuPree and The Promise. The collection also includes correspondence with publishers such as Pan MacMillan; articles written by Weisgarber; and materials from writing conferences and workshops. The folder titles preceding a semicolon reflect Weisgarber's original descriptions.

did.unittitle: Accession 2019-050
did.abstract: Archival materials received from Ann Weisgarber. Majority of the materials pertaining to research and drafts of her novel, The Glovemaker. Correspondence e-mails with her editor, Josie Humber, and publishing company Mantle/ MacMillian of the UK, as well as, a film offer for The Personal History of Rachel Dupree. Included are many revisions of chapters 1-23 of The Glovemaker (Excluding chapter 16). Ann Weisgarber was on the TIF council for "Texas Institute of Letters- 82nd annual Awards Banquet" which awarded recipients Sandra Cisneros, Bill Wittliff, and Jan Reid amongst many others.

did.unittitle: Manila folder titled "For Fun" includes a thank you letter from the Wittliff Collections dated June 11, 2018 and letter written to Laura Bush December 26,2000; Manilla folder marked "The Glovemaker- Nagel & Kimche-Zurich (German Translation) including email exchanges between Anne Weisgarber and her agent, Anna Halton and the German offer for The Glovemaker by publishing company Nagel & Kimche, corrections and comments byKatherine Razum (German Translator), & Exchanges with German editor-Patricia Reimann. November 16, 2017- November 9, 2018; Manila folder"From Readers" including two cards from fans, abstract water colored card with pressed flower; Manila folder "Film option-The Personal History of Rachel Dupree" including correspondence between Ann Weisgarber, Producer Brian Armstrong/Brian Rosen, Harriet Sonders- Former rights Director of MacMillan UK, director/Screenwriter Claire McCarthy, Agent Margaret Halton, August 2017-October 2018. Contract for JuVee Productions renewal August 29, 2018.

Manila folder titled "Events" includes printed brochure "The Bosque Arts Center Presents: Books on the Bosque" invitation to hear review of The Personal History of Rachel Dupree, "The Art of Business: Taking a Novel Approach to Business" booklet with article on Ann Weisgarber, Invitation to a reading with Ann Weisgarber in Galveston, "Texas Institute of Letters- 82nd annual Awards Banquet" program includes Sandra Cisneros, Bill Wittliff, Jan Reid and memorials for Elroy Bode, Bill Crider, Audrey Slate, April 7, 2018; Manila folder "Rejections of The Glovemaker by John Sicilano- Penguin Random House" includes correspondence with Jon Mitchell, MacMillan, Rejection from Viking, Considerations for Skyhorse July 19, 2017; Manila folder "The Glovemaker-UK Mantle" correspondence with Editor Josie Humber and Marie Ryt, includes written annotations on letter exchanges between characters "Deborah" and "Samuel" & book's launch on Amazon, November 2017- August 2018.

Manila folder titled "Correspondence with Margaret Halton-Agent in the UK" includes The Glovemaker's title options: Manila folder "Research- The Dressmaker" includes calendar from 1888-1887 with nots on novels dates and events, printouts of information on Utah and Mormonism, printout on indigenous trees of Utah, printout on the 49th Congressional Act, April, 2016-November 22, 2017; Manila folder "Research-The Glovemaker- Utah Research" includes handwritten notes, printout on Utah State University's "The United States Marshals in Utah Territory to 1896" thesis and dissertation by Vernal A. Brown (1970) with annotations by Ann Weisgarber. 1970-November 22, 2017.

Manila folder "The Glovemaker- UK Mantle/Pan MacMillian- copy/edits with Mary Chamberlain 'Proofreader'" includes several correspondences regarding edits November 16, 2017- April 2018; Manila folder "Prologue revisions- The Glovemaker" with heavy annotations; Manila folder "The Glovemaker-Chapter One" printouts of Chapter One and several revisions. May 27, 2012- May 24, 2017

Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Two" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Three" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Four" printouts of revisions. March 2015- May 24, 2017.

Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Six" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "First Letter" printout of "Samuel Tyler's letters; "Manila folder "Third Letter" printout of "Samuel Tyler's" third letter; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Seven" printouts of revisions. December 2012-August 10, 2017.

Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Eight" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Nine" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Ten" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Eleven" printouts of revisions; Manila folder "The Glovemaker- Chapter Twelve" printouts of revisions. August 2013- May 27, 2017.
